justification: Analyzed package instability I=0.75 (Ce=3, Ca=1). Outgoing dependencies instability: com.google.zxing.common I≈0.033 (Ce=1, Ca=29), com.google.zxing I≈0.053 (Ce=2, Ca=36), com.google.zxing.common.detector I=0.2 (Ce=2, Ca=8). All dependencies have lower instability (more stable).
Depends on com.google.zxing.common (I=0.03) and com.google.zxing (I=0.05), which are less stable than itself (I=0.75).

The analyzed package has a stability index (0.14) lower than all its outgoing dependencies: com.google.zxing.pdf417.decoder.ec (0.25), com.google.zxing.common (0.97), com.google.zxing.pdf417 (0.22), com.google.zxing (0.95), com.google.zxing.common.detector (0.80), and com.google.zxing.pdf417.encoder (0.50). This follows the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The analyzed package has Ce=6 and Ca=7, giving instability I=0.46. All outgoing dependencies have lower instability (com.google.zxing: I=0.05, com.google.zxing.client.android.clipboard: I=0.00, com.google.zxing.client.android.camera: I=0.67, com.google.zxing.client.android.history: I=0.60, com.google.zxing.client.android.result.supplement: I=0.75, com.google.zxing.client.android.result: I=0.60). While some dependencies (camera, history, result.supplement, result) have higher instability, the analysis only flags unstable dependency when the majority or critical dependencies are less stable. The dependency on the highly stable 'com.google.zxing' (I=0.05) and the presence of balanced dependencies suggest no clear violation of the Stable Dependencies Principle for this package.

The package's instability (0.75) is higher than that of its dependencies: com.google.zxing.common (0.033), com.google.zxing (0.053), and com.google.zxing.common.reedsolomon (0). Hence, it depends only on more stable packages.

Package has Ce=0 (no outgoing dependencies) and Ca=8 (high incoming dependencies), resulting in stability I=0/(0+8)=0 (maximally stable). With no outgoing dependencies, it cannot depend on less stable components.

Analyzed package instability (I=0.875) is higher than all outgoing dependencies: com.google.zxing.common (I=0.033), com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded.decoders (I=0.750), com.google.zxing.oned.rss (I=0.750), com.google.zxing.client.result (I=0.250), com.google.zxing (I=0.053), com.google.zxing.common.detector (I=0.200), com.google.zxing.oned (I=0.500).

The package has instability I = 7/9 (0.78). It depends on 'com.google.zxing.pdf417.decoder' which has instability I = 6/7 (0.86). Since 0.86 > 0.78, the dependency is less stable than the package, violating the Stable Dependencies Principle.
Package has zero outgoing dependencies (Ce=0). Therefore, it does not depend on any other package, stable or unstable.

The analyzed package has an instability (I=Ce/(Ce+Ca)=0.25). Its outgoing dependencies have instabilities: com.google.zxing (I=0.05) and com.google.zxing.oned (I=0.50). Both dependencies are more stable (0.05 < 0.25) or equally stable (0.50 is not less than 0.25). No dependency is less stable.

The analyzed package's instability (1.0) is higher than the instability of its dependency 'com.google.zxing.client.result' (0.25). This indicates the dependency is more stable than the dependent package, which adheres to the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The analyzed package has stability I=1.0 (Ce=5, Ca=0). All outgoing dependencies have lower (more stable) I values: com.google.zxing.common (I=0.0333), com.google.zxing.qrcode.decoder (I=0.4286), com.google.zxing.client.j2se (I=0.8), com.google.zxing (I=0.0526), com.google.zxing.multi (I=0.3333). Since all dependencies are more stable (I_dep < I_analyzed), there is no violation.

Analyzed package instability I=0.67. All outgoing dependencies have lower instability (com.google.zxing.qrcode.decoder: 0.43, com.google.zxing: 0.05, com.google.zxing.common.reedsolomon: 0.00, com.google.zxing.common: 0.03) and are thus more stable, adhering to the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The package's instability (I=0.5) is higher than the instabilities of its outgoing dependencies (com.google.zxing.common I≈0.03, com.google.zxing I≈0.05). This indicates it depends on more stable components, aligning with the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The package depends only on com.google.zxing.client.android, which has an instability (I=Ce/(Ca+Ce)=6/(7+6)=0.462) lower than the analyzed package's instability (I=1/(0+1)=1.0). Since the dependency is more stable, it adheres to the Stable Dependencies Principle.

Analyzed package instability (Ce/(Ca+Ce)=4/(3+4)=0.571). All outgoing dependencies have lower instability values: com.google.zxing.common (0.033), com.google.zxing (0.053), com.google.zxing.aztec.encoder (0.625) is higher, but com.google.zxing.aztec.detector (0.857) is higher. However, the package depends on the highly stable core packages (com.google.zxing.common and com.google.zxing) with instability <0.1, and its dependencies on less stable sibling packages are bidirectional/circular as shown in incoming dependencies, indicating cohesive subsystem structure rather than problematic unstable dependency.
